Abstract: With the midsummer sun standing high over the South Pole, painting its vast featureless snow fields with light so intense it hurt the eyes, scientists and support staff began celebrating the new year along with a planeload of tourists and seven intrepid  skiers.     Midnight itself was almost meaningless; at this time of year, the sun shines 24 hours a day.

Headline.PrintHeadline: 1/1/00: AROUND THE WORLD; Absence of 'Midnight' Doesn't Darken Spirits
